reviewText: This is a wonderful bellydance instructional DVD!  The instructor breaks down the bellydance moves slowly and because the DVD is so well organized, you can easily repeat the selections.  The instructor performs the moves alone in front of a full length mirror in a dance studio.  This helps you see the movements from the front, back, and sides.  I also appreciated the feature of being able to view the combination moves with music only or with music and instruction.  This is a keeper.
summary: Simple, clear and easy to follow for the beginner.
Title: N/A

reviewText: How do you argue with almost two and a half hours of content on one little disk--at hardly any cost? In my collection, I have DVDs that offer one tenth the amount of content at an average of $40. This video has an incredible amount of instruction. More than I've seen on any other single video, in fact. It's an entire belly dance syllabus. The teaching is authoritative--as it should be, coming from someone who really knows. It's detailed and thorough. Despite being such a long DVD, the pace is perfect and consistent throughout. There isn't any section where get disoriented with a sudden variation in style or pace. The relaxed and flowing feel of the whole DVD actually adds to the learning experience.There are now dozens and dozens of beginner bellydance instruction videos. I've always wondered just how the market supports quite that many. Among them, this one now ranks among the top few because you find everyone in on e place, explained and demonstrated well. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to the next person who asks what they should have in their starter kit.Unlike many of the other dvds, you'll find a section on traveling steps and layering. So it really does live up to its promise of basics and beyond. It has a sizeable practice section which is quite useful.The only thing that could have added to it, in my opinion, is the choreography notes (perhaps even on screen) for the performance to Layla.What can beginners get out of this? Everything in one easy solid package.What can intermediate dancers get out of it? A good reference, and a workout plus drill.It's unbelievable value for money.
summary: The most comprehensive bellydance instruction ever
Title: N/A

reviewText: I agree with all the other excellent reviews - I followed their advice and bought this dvd and I love it.  I'm an advanced beginner and this dvd has helped me with some of my weaker areas (traveling steps) that I didn't pick up well in either of my two classes.  I love the chapter headings which make it easy to navigate between the lessons and Jenna explains the movements very well.  I liked this dvd so much I bought another for my sister!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is my first tutorial DVD and I think it's excellent, I've seen other "free" clips online for various moves but Jenna makes it easy!!I love the studio surroundings with the large mirror, and in most shots Jenna is facing away from us, I find that I can easily become confused the other way around when the instructor is facing me on the TV.  Here I feel like I'm practicing right behind her.  I've only had the DVD for one day and I'm managed to cover almost all the moves, it just takes practice gals, don't give up, it will come to you with time,  I honestly thought I'd never be able to do a shimmy and just today for my second day practicing with Jenna I'm almost there!This DVD is fun and it's a great workout, also the warmups and arm movements segments are really nice stretches and will make you feel better overall.I highly recommend the DVD, if you're a beginner like myself and not sure what to choose from all the DVDs out there I say go for this one, also because Jenna has a second choreography DVD "The heartbeat of belly dance" and just like the first it's a really helpful tool to piece together what you've learned and smooth it together to make a beautiful dance.Both DVDs are wonderful!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a beginner, who goes to a local class in a small country town and wanted something to practice with at home to ensure I learn correct technique.I have about 10 DVD's and two of Jenna's this and the next one in the series - Transitions etc.Simply put they are EXCELLENT and make the others pale by comparison.I like the quality, the easy instruction, the mirror showing all angles quite simply they are perfect.I wish Jenna had more as I would buy them for the next level and beyond.  So pleased I bought them and they are terrific value for money with 2hrs worth on one DVD of USEFUL stuff.Awesome!
Title: N/A

reviewText: For the dollar amount this DVD delivers valuable instruction without compromising quality. Full of valuable instruction it clearly covers basic foudation moves of bellydance- from undulations, hipwork, to arm movements, as well as a section on posture and a brief warm-up. You are  able to clearly see what she is demonstrating from the front and the back, just as if you were taking a class with an instructor. This is helpful when trying to learn the move yourself.Jenna also covers basic traveling steps, and shows you how to incorporate the travel steps with the isolations. She has a drill portion of the DVD that allows you to practice and layer the moves in different combinations.Most professionally produced bellydance instructional DVDs can cost anywhere from $30-$40. I take bellydance classes and have bought countless DVDs for practice. I have paid $40 for a DVD by a reputable dancer and the production quality and clarity of the instruction of Bellydance Basics and Beyond with Jenna was far better.If you want a good Beginner Bellydance DVD for practice or as an introduction, this is a great one to try for the price.
summary: Best Value for the Beginner Bellydancer

It uses your body differently then other exercise or dance I've done and I do feel like I'm getting some benefits.

Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an excellent DVD for a beginning belly dance student. Jenna's instructions are very clear, and the camera work and her position in a mirrored room so you can see her from two angles is very helpful. There is a lot of content on here, so it's definitely a good value. Chapters are broken down by isolations, arms, circles, etc. and those movements are taught without music. You can stop the DVD to keep practicing a move if she moves on before you're ready. But there's also a practice section where you can drill the moves w/ music and you can make the choice to have her instructions or only music. She's a very good teacher, and I'm using this to practice the basic moves in between my live classes. (My teacher says it's very important not to jump ahead to more fancy moves until the basics are drilled into your muscle memory, so I think this is a very useful practice tool.)
summary: A Lot of Bang for the Buck

reviewText: This is an excellent reference DVD for beginners.  The instructions are simple and clear.  Jenna then practices each move slowly a couple of times and then quickly a couple of times.  This is not a good dvd for drilling the moves.  Once you get the gist of the moves you will need to stop the dvd and practice to your own music.  But if instruction is all you need then this is a good dvd.

Title: N/A

reviewText: As other viewers testify, this IS a great instructional dvd for an absolute bellydance beginner. If you cannot access a live class, this dvd is the best substitute available there.The dvd contains:-Isolation movements (shoulders, ribcage, hips)-Compound movements (as above)-Layered movements (arms + legwork)-One performance, approximately 5 minutesPros:-Comprehensive instructions of basic bellydance moves. Every move is broken down into the simplest element. For example, in the isolation shoulder section, the explanation for the "shoulder roll" movement starts with lifting of the shoulders up closer to the ears. With this level of breakdown, this instruction serves self-teaching bellydancer very well-The short performance. After several times of practicing the movements, I encourage everyone to try the performance on her own. This will greatly help you to understand the difference between pure movements and actual dancing with music. For instance, if you need to fast turn and then move the ribcage sidewise, this is much more demanding than sliding the ribcage to the sides, while standing still the whole time. In fact, integrating the performance in your practice will be the key to improve your bellydance techniques with this dvdCons:-Unlike a live class, dvd are watched repeatedly. This dvd does not take this into account. While the dvd is great to watch for the first 2-3 times, after that the tempo is too slow. For example, the shoulder lift mentioned above becomes annoying, because it does not contribute to your exercise anymore. This dvd could have earned 5 stars, if it took progress of viewers into account by offering difference levels within the dvd-Only one performance is included. As above, integrating the performance into your practice routine will be essential to master the movements. Given this, more than one varying performances could have been a great addition to the dvdOverall, this is an outstanding instructional dvd for bellydance beginners however does not sustain the benefits after repeated viewings.
summary: Great for first views. When progressed instructions feel too slow
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've had this DVD for about a year, and finally found the motivation to go through it. I found it disappointing. There is a lot of basic instruction here, so no misrepresntation there - it does exactly what the title says: gives you technique and instruction on the basics. But most of the instruction is done in a bare studio with no music! What kind of dance teacher would fail to bring any music? These music-free sections are the kind of thing you might want to do once or twice, to get posture and technique, but then you would be done with them, and ready to move on. Later sections do give some dancing with music, but I found Jenna's dance style very stiff and graceless. She seems to know what she's doing, and, unlike some of the tribal style intructors, is not afraid to actually pick up her feet and MOVE herself on the floor, but she's no performer, and I feel no inclination to do this workout a second time. I will be adding this DVD to my trade/sell stack, and going back to Ariella and Ashara.

reviewText: This is a must have for anyone that is interested in belly dancing. If your looking for weightloss or just wanting to learning the dance! If your like me and are not too good at keeping yourself in good posture, that by itself is a good workout! On the menu screen she has EVERYTHING broken down (her intro, posture & arms, warmup, etc.). You can tell she really knows her stuff and really explains everything well! Its like having a personal dance instructor in you own livingroom!I also like that in her dance routine with her students, that you don't have to already be a skinny risqué looking girl to learn to bellydance. Even though you may not be the thinnest, you can still dance and look attractive!I highly recomend this DVD! It really is a total body workout!

reviewText: This DVD gives you a very good basic, one on one instruction. It's just you & the instructor in her studio. She stands in front of a mirrored wall for the most part, and does each step slowly, so you really get a good feel for what she's doing & how it should look from all angles. Her instruction is careful and patient, & I understand exactly what I should be doing. This DVD really focuses on very basic movements, then puts it all together in combinations so you have something to look forward to (so you actually get to belly dance, even as a beginner!). Her clothing is attractive & exposes her belly & waist so you can really see how the muscles work. It's just like having a personal lesson! I'm really motivated to keep practicing and learn more.Addended May 9, 2007 from original March 24, 2007 review:Again, this is a **starter** DVD & it's not a work-out. I have moved on but I'm glad I started **here**. Once you have the moves down pretty well, you can move on to more extensive instruction, such as "Sacred Bellydance" by Jehan (GREAT), or more workout-oriented titles. This one will teach you the basic movements so you can practice & start to develop the "muscle memory" that will later allow you to incorporate them into actual dance. By the way, if you're not used to it, these movements will make muscles hurt that you didn't know you had. It's great "core"/abs/lowerback/arms work. If these areas are weak, I'd suggest you practice often to strengthen them. I'm no expert, but from my experience starting this after birthing 3 kids & long after my days of "work-out" glory, it's hard to do these movements gracefully with weak muscles. Muscle strength = muscle control. The grace of any dancer belies the strength that most styles of dance require.
Title: N/A

reviewText: EXCELLENT BD DVD'S FOR TOTAL BEGINNERS. I may have other beginner DVD's, but the following are my top pics because all include a detailed tutorial section that break down the moves slowly and without music. Of course tutorials are boring, specially if you are not totally new to BD or if you prefer to learn by dancing from the very first step. However, if you are an absolute beginner in BD, you probably need this instruction, since you need to isolate a lot of muscles you did not even know you could voluntarily move. This DVD will provide you one of the most detailed technique sections you will find and probably the most complete one in terms of variety of moves. Jenna explains almost every shoulder/rib/hip move & footstep I have seen so far. Additionally, she practises each move together with you, giving you hints and tips during the practise, so you practise with constant reminders as if you were in a class.Love Potion - The Bellydance Workoutby Neon gives you a good all round beginner tutorial plus a 50 min. beginner dance flow and a 50 min. workout, which is a bit tougher, so you can continue to use this DVD once you improve your skills.Bellydance: Beautiful Technique from Step One, with Autumn Ward: Beginner belly dancing classes, Belly dance how-to, Beginner bellydance instructionis excellent and it includes the most detailed technique section I have seen, but only for lower body (upper body isolations and footwork are left for other instructionals). However, I am not sure if it's for total beginners, since Autumn does not include individual practise time for each independent move, the only practise time you get is different moves strung together in a flow.Belly By Sandra Vol 1: Isolations (Bellydance Instructional)is also excellent for beginners. Sandra first explains each move, including muscular engagement, posture, etc. without music and also giving you truly interesting background information as to how the move is executed in "Middle Eastern Dance" vs other dance forms like "African", "Jazz", etc. Then she drills each move with excellent drum music, making your drilling much more fun so you do not get bored so easily. However, you would need to buy Vol 1 and 2 and still don't get as many moves as with Jenna.The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because at some point when you more or less master the steps, you stop using this DVD and move to a drilling or dancing one. I used this one almost for two months alternating it with another beginner DVD, so you grow out of it quickly or better said, you get bored quickly, even if you have not completely "mastered" the technique. However, at the very beginning you would probably feel intimidated by other DVD's that allow you to grow with them, likeSerpentine - Belly Dance with Rachel Brice :: Bellydance Technique & Yoga for Strong, Relaxed & Sinuous MovementandThe Bellydance Tribal Fusion Workout.I bought Jenna's DVD and Neon'sBellydance: First Steps - step-by-step belly dance instruction & 2 hours of non-stop practice for Total Beginnerssimultaneously as my very first introduction to bellydance (cero dance classes of any genre before, although I have some "Dance off the Inches", "Crunch" and "10 Minute Solutions" dance DVD's). First I tried Neon's, I turned it off without passing chapter 1 (maybe I should have repeated it, I do not know). Then I turned to Jenna for one week and returned to Neon with more success. I alternated both DVD's and was very happy with this solution for my starting phase. While doing Neon's DVD my hips hurt I would say badly days after I did it. I was doing something wrong, but I do not know what, probably pushing my hips out instead of bending my knees? (P.D. Now, after watchingThe Baladi: Bellydance Egyptian Style, with Ranya Renée (TWO-DVD SET): Open level traditional Egyptian style belly dance classes, Arabic-style belly dance instruction, Egyptian bellydancing how-to- which is packed with security tips - I know that I was not using my glutes and leg muscles to drive and contain the Sharp hip pushes, that's why it hurt). This did not happen as I did Jenna's DVD, since she is not using so many sharp hip pushes as Neon, which is more suitable for a total beginner.CARDIO CHALLENGE: Low  TONING: Low  CHOREOGRAPHY DIFFICULTY: Beginner to Intermediate  INSTRUCTIONAL QUALITY: Very good  MUSIC: Very good in the practise w/music  FUN FACTOR: High in the practise w/musicCONTENTS:1) POSTURE & SAFETY: explanation of posture and arm positions / safety2) WARM_UP: Perfect-length warm-up. No stretches or yoga, just slow movements that look "dancy" because they are accompanied by graceful arm positions to warm-up your joints and muscles (very BD specific warm-up).3) TUTORIAL: Very detailed and lengthy - Shoulders/Ribs/hips isolations, Circles/figure 8's/undulations and Footwork/Layered steps. It starts by breaking down, isolating & practising the simplest moves for example of the hip on a single plane and direction: left-right, forward-back, up-down, etc., then combines two of these directions to form a square: right-back-left-forward, etc., always giving safety and posture tips. The tutorial is not just a slow break down of the moves with explanations, it also includes practise time together with Jenna giving you reminders of weight placement & posture (you do not need to stop & rewind to practise). You really repeat each move several times at a very slow pace, so it is more a practise tutorial, but completely without music that could distract you (kind of boring once you get the moves, but probably necessary at the very beginning to concentrate).4) FIVE DANCE FLOWS: 5 minute segments of practise with an excellent choice of music. When compared to other dance flows, with Jenna you move more in space (more footwork and traveling steps) so you really feel like dancing. After acquiring Ranya's "The Baladi", I kind of realized that these segments are more like a brief improvisational auxiliary of moves. What do I mean? Well, it's not a choreography, but rather a "dance flow", almost as an improvisation where you follow along Jenna's "hints". You're not taught the combinations before you start dancing, it just flows I would say "miraculously", this definitely helps you "get" more fluid transitions in your movement. The combinations are not repeated a couple of times (workout format) and there aren't any "from the top's", but rather one move "flows" into the next in a seamless progression. (LOVE IT). As mentioned, other dance practise sessions are structured in a workout format while still others are more choreographed, so you will need to discover your preferences. The last of these segments is dedicated to arms and is part standing (snake arms) and part floor cool-down. The cool down is not so good (there are better stretches). Unfortunately 25 minutes of real dance is short and when you consider that part of the last session is already a cool down, you only have 20 min. so I only use this DVD when I cannot do a longer one.5) SMALL DANCE: by Jenna and her students (5 min.) - unfortunately it is not cued but it's doable with repetition. You can download a Word document containing a breakdown of the choreography from Jenna's web page (beyondbellydance.com).MUSIC:No music in the tutorial section, which is the main part of the DVD. Very nice and happy music (instrumental) in the practise sessions. I appreciate very much that the music has no lyrics, since I find it somewhat distracting when you need to concentrate on learning difficult isolations.EMPHASIS:Good overall emphasis for beginners, has more footwork and traveling steps than other beginner DVD's, but almost no arm embellishments, except for snake arms.WHAT IS BETTER THAN IN OTHER DVD'S:+ Detailed tutorial: Excellent for total beginners with each isolation pratised several times. The practise with hints and tips during the practise is what makes this DVD invaluable; very good for learning.+ More different moves than in most DVD's: specially footwork and layered steps are more thorough than in other DVD's, I will still do these tutorials sometimes. Ranya's Baladi DVD has also instruction on footwork for the faster maqsoum rythms; the steps are almost the same than in this DVD. The difference between both instructors is that Ranya explains better where you can use the steps during the Baladi and to which rythm but dedicates no time for practising the move, whereas Jenna explains the step slowly and includes more repetitions for you to practise them.+ Best explanation of the walking turn and the 3-step turn I have seen, since she not only tells you exactly when to turn the head, she practises it with you several times at different speeds, indicating each time when you should turn.+ Nice BD focused dancey warm-up: I use this for other bellydance DVD's that do not have one, like Neon's.+ Almost like real dancing: Nice flow in the 25 minute practise sessions with music and the final dance.+ Good music: Enyoyable music selection in the practise sessions(Mar 2014) I need to add that I returned to this DVD after more than a year of not using it and I must say that the "dance flows" are truly EXCELLENT. Try them again when you have made some progress in your bellydancing and you will understand why this DVD is called "Basics and beyond...". Now that I have done this, I think I am still not ready for "The Next Level" with Jenna. Maybe I was wrong when I gave it 4 stars; it's an absolute beginner DVD but the dance flows are excellent for advanced beginners or intermediate dancers.
summary: Mainly for absolute beginners, specially for those without a real life teacher.

reviewText: Okay so I have quite a few DVD's beginner to advanced.  I have Amira, Blanca, Neon, Leila (sp? shimmies).  Anyhow for someone who is new to bellydance Jenna's DVD is my top pick.  Here's my 1-5 scale run down for why.  One is Blah and five Fabulous.Time:  5  can you say long and thorough?  great menu options for accessibility although wish they were highlighted in something other than white.Visuals:  5  You can see her legs (yeah!), nothing distracting in a word perfectReplayability:  5  From hipdrops, to shimmies and everything you never thought of before or has been presented by other DVD's it's on here.  I play this one every day.  It's not as fun as say Shamiras but then I somehow figured out Shamira's and was missing a massive amount of the bellydancing fundamentals.  I still recommend Shamiras and Blancas, but for basics this is the top of the line.Cost:  5 love it; so worth every pennyInstructor likability:  5 Jenna's  very elegant, professional, cuing is on target.Recommend:  5  You won't find anything better and this DVD has been ten times more thorough than my bellydance class I'm taking; which is why I just love this DVD, but am disgruntled with my bellydance class.Thinking of buying?  Don't hesitate.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This isn't a workout tape.  It's not a choreography tape.  It's bellydance technique.What's good about it, though, is that it teaches introductory bellydance vocabulary with very clear descriptions of what happens when (and where).  Lots of other bellydance instructors teach technique well, but the best of them can be intimidating.  (Some are too fast;  some just have a lot more endurance than your average beginner student.)When I started trying to teach myself to dance, I had days when I could not bring myself to practice because the level of tape that I started with was too technically difficult--not so with this dvd.  This isn't too difficult for a rank beginner.I wouldn't buy this if you are looking for a dance tape:  I would buy it if you want to know what you are really supposed to be doing if you are going to teach yourself bellydance without the benefit of a teacher.Edit:  After a few more viewings, I have to say that this is like a master class--watch it to see what else you pick up about technique.  For really good, very basic technique, get Bellydance for Core Fitness and watch Ayshe's instructional segment.  THAT is what really taught me to dance.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Over 2 hours of great detailed workshop at your own leisure!. I love learning technique and I appreciate Jenna's very detailed instruction. Learn proper dance posture, which is truly the foundation for correct arm work, hip work- isolations, layering, undulating . Learn to layer simple moves, compound moves while adding travel steps! A choice of music only as you practice along, or voice and music as you enter the program initially. You can build your own workout sessions with all the combinations included. This was a great learning experience, a true workshop with very detailed, broken down instruction. This is a must have dvd for learning basics and more, also for future reference. A great variety of music as you learn the different moves. Jenna is pleasant, easy to understand, and her moves are defined clearly so it is easy to follow along. The setting is professional studio and shows Jenna utilizing a mirror for better visual aid.Excellent for beginner and enriching for those expanding their bellydance knowledge. Cooldown is included. Also a delightful choreography added as a bonus with Jenna and her students. The choreography is easy to breakdown and learn. This a great learning program!!!
summary: A great detailed workshop at your leisure!
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you are unable to go for a "live" class, this DVD helps you get the basics down and introduces you to bellydance with beautiful step-by-step tutorials. A major plus point of the DVD is that it contains a full 2.5 hours of material. Yes, two and a half HOURS.It is set in a studio - with a wall-to-wall mirrors on the front, at an angle .. so essentially you the viewer can see the moves from the front and the back. You will miss nothing of the footwork or body and arm movements, and this is very important especially with bellydancing.This setting is a major plus as it does make it feel like you are "in" the studio. The instructor, Jenna, also helps contribute to this, with her nice pleasing speech and manner .. so that it feels like a 1-on-1 class (but in your living room!). She is also not very intimidating - unlike most fitness videos or even bellydancing videos.It starts off with the absolute basics - with each body part done individually - the shoulders, the legs, the hips etc. All the movements are done or should I say, introduced separately before combining them together as you move further along with the DVD.I highly recommend this, especially since it seems like such a steal for the amount of content you get in the DVD.

reviewText: I bought this when I first began belly dancing and in my opinion was great for beginners! Jenna starts off with a nice warm-up to get your body ready for the rest! She teaches you the basic moves from lower movements, to upper movements and isolations and compound moves, and even footwork! Then, you get to practice what you've learned in the "Practice Combination" section. At the end, you get a little entertainment of what belly dance is really like as Jenna and her students perform a small dance! This dvd is great for beginner belly dancers and also very beneficial for those intermediate and advanced people who want to drill the basics! Either way, you'll be satisfied with the famous Jenna's "Bellydance Basics and Beyond"!
